name: "Ultimate Fantastic Four" Quiz | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: During Reed and Sue's attempt to be inconspicuous, what does Sue test out?
questions.explanation:
Perfume.

	Reed becomes very nervous when Sue asks him to pick between two perfumes. He's much more at home in his science lab. Reed was asked to make this difficult decision in "Ultimate Fantastic Four" #33, which went on sale in October of 2006.

Seed.

	Threshold leads a group of aliens that follow the commands of a crystal-shaped item called Seed. They rebel against Ronan the Accuser and his death-defying boss, Thanos. They first appeared in "Ultimate Fantastic Four" #33, which debuted in October of 2006.

questions.text: Who arrives in pursuit of Threshold's group?
questions.explanation:
Gallowglass.

	Gallowglass is Thanos' son, and he first appeared in "Ultimate Fantastic Four" #34, which debuted in November of 2006. His body is composed of star matter, and he must keep a forcefield around himself at all times. He is defeated when Sue breaks his forcefield, making him explode.

questions.text: Where had Ronan handled a rebellion before coming back to Acheron?
questions.explanation:
Pyx.

	Ronan the Accuser is Acheron's justice system, accusing, convicting, and executing those he deems guilty, which is a lot of people! He doesn't know how long his father has been dead because he was away on planet Pyx defeating an uprising. Ultimate Ronan first appeared in "Ultimate Fantastic Four" #35, which went on sale in December of 2006.

questions.text: When Thanos is finally revived from death, with whom does he wish to speak?
questions.explanation:
Gallowglass.

	Gallowglass and his hordes were the only people in Thanos' empire to have come in contact with Reed Richards, whom Thanos values for his genius-level intellect. Thanos was reborn in "Ultimate Fantastic Four" #35, which went on sale in 2006.

questions.text: Whose body does Thanos take over?
questions.explanation:
Ben Grimm's body.

	In order to more easily talk to Reed, Thanos takes over Ben Grimm's body. While most speech boxes in comic books are white with black letters, Thanos speaks in black speech boxes with white letters. How dastardly! Thanos pulled this trick off at the end of the 35th issue of "Ultimate Fantastic Four", which went on sale in 2006.

questions.text: What does Thanos want Reed to make?
questions.explanation:
A Cosmic Cube.

	A Cosmic Cube is a cube-shaped device that allows the user to change reality to their own desires. As such , they are highly-valued things. Although Reed refuses to craft such an object for Thanos, he begins work on one to use on the tyrant should he return to menace the team.

questions.text: What experiments weren't underway at Nursery Two?
options: Experiments in turning things to crystal
questions.explanation:
Super Soldier experiments.

	In "Ultimate Fantastic Four Annual" #2, which debuted in 2007, the team goes to Nursery Two to free the lab from the control of Mole Man and his underground hordes. At the end, some students elect to stay underground and continue work without the pressure from the United States government.

False.

	Diablo used his mystic arts to kidnap people closest to the members of the team. Reed's sister disappeared, Sue's father disappeared, Johnny's current girlfriend disappeared, and Ben's mother disappeared. Luckily, the team was able to rescue their loved ones. Diablo absconded with the unlucky folks in "Ultimate Fantastic Four" #39, which debuted in 2007.

questions.text: What color did Ben Grimm turn?
questions.explanation:
Blue.

	In "Ultimate Fantastic Four" #41, which went on sale in 2007, one of Diablo's attacks shattered Ben Grimm like so many ice cubes. With some hasty assembling from his friends and some magic elixir, Ben was made whole again, although a light blue color remained on the previously-orange man.
